So is this a proper repack or is it just more crummy encoded bullshit released just to say "FIRST LOL"? These release groups need to realize that we don't give a shit about it being first if it's not even properly encoded. I'd MUCH rather wait another hour or two and avoid shit like THIS which just takes more time and bandwidth in the end. 

So, good/bad? Anyone that ISN'T just going to point fingers at other rg's?

Good quality, watched it last night, no significant issues that I remember.

As is typical, the low-contrast scenes in blowing snow "north of the wall" looked grainy and had artifacts (mostly haloing/ringing).  The rest of the episode was pretty much flawless.  

I understand that those are the most difficult scenes to encode and need a much higher bitrate than the rest of the episode... but when people are trying to get stuff encoded and released in real-time, there's just no practical way to do that.  It would take slow, 2-pass encoding, or constant quality/VBR encoding with unpredictable file sizes.
